HAproxy for LB purposes

attrs.script:
# Set the hostname accordingly
hostnamectl set-hostname @@{name}@@
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hosts
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hostname

# Update the system to the latest packages
apt-get update

# Do to possible 
DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get -y -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confdef" -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confold" upgrade
sh -c "echo 'LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8\nLANG=en_US.UTF-8' >> /etc/environment"

#!/bin/bash
# Setting the parameters for silent install of the MariaDB packages
# root as username and password for the variable 
#echo mysql-server-5.5 mysql-server/root_password password @@{MariaDB_Root_Password}@@ | debconf-set-selections
#echo mysql-server-5.5 mysql-server/root_password_again password @@{MariaDB_Root_Password}@@ | debconf-set-selections
debconf-set-selections <<< 'mariadb-server-10.0 mysql-server/root_password password nutanix/4u'
debconf-set-selections <<< 'mariadb-server-10.0 mysql-server/root_password_again password nutanix/4u'
	
apt-get install -y mariadb-server

# make sure MariaDB is listening on not just 127.0.0.1
sed -i "s:bind-address:#bind-address:g" /etc/mysql/mariadb.conf.d/50-server.cnf

# restart the MariaDB service
service mysql restart

#!/bin/bash
# Setting the parameters for silent install of the MariaDB packages
# root as username and password for the variable 
#echo mysql-server-5.5 mysql-server/root_password password @@{MariaDB_Root_Password}@@ | debconf-set-selections
#echo mysql-server-5.5 mysql-server/root_password_again password @@{MariaDB_Root_Password}@@ | debconf-set-selections
debconf-set-selections <<< 'mariadb-server-10.0 mysql-server/root_password password nutanix/4u'
debconf-set-selections <<< 'mariadb-server-10.0 mysql-server/root_password_again password nutanix/4u'

# make sure MariaDB is listening on not just 127.0.0.1

action_list.description: System action for installing an application

attrs.script:
# Set the hostname accordingly
hostnamectl set-hostname @@{name}@@
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hosts
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hostname

# Update the system to the latest packages
apt-get update

# Do to possible 
DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get -y -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confdef" -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confold" upgrade
sh -c "echo 'LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8\nLANG=en_US.UTF-8' >> /etc/environment"

# install nginx and the php engine for the dynamic data from the mariadb database
apt-get install -y nginx php-fpm php-mysql

# change the nginx configuragtion page
sed -i "s/index.html/index.html index.php/g" /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i "s/#location ~/location ~/g" /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i "s/#\tinclude snippets/\tinclude snippets/g" /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i "s:#\tfastcgi_pass unix:\tfastcgi_pass unix:g" /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i '0,/#}/s//}/' /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i "s:#\tdeny all:\tdeny all:g" /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i '0,/#}/s//}/' /etc/nginx/sites-available/default

# create a fast test php page				
echo '<?php phpinfo(); ?>' | tee /var/www/html/info.php
				
# Command to check the nginx configuration file
nginx -t

# restart the nginx webserver due to config changes
systemctl reload nginx

# cd into the right location due to pull from github using wget
cd /var/www/html
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessenstam/NutanixWorkshops/master/index.php

# change a parameter in the index.php file
sed -i 's:DATABASE_IP:@@{MariaDB.address}@@:g' index.php

# Install sshpass
apt-get install -y sshpass

#!/bin/bash

# get some commandline calculator
apt-get install bc

# set the array index we need to manipulate the LB config file
teller=$(echo "1+1*@@{calm_array_index}@@" | bc)

# Debug teller
#echo $teller > /tmp/teller.log

# wait for 5 seconds
sleep $teller

#use sshpass to manipulate the LB
echo @@{WebServer.name}@@ > /tmp/webservernamear
echo @@{WebServer.address}@@ > /tmp/webserveripar

# extract the right values from the dump of the Calm macros
webserver_name=$(cat /tmp/webservernamear | cut -d"," -f$teller)
webserver_ip=$(cat /tmp/webserveripar | cut -d"," -f$teller)

# extra debug
#echo $webserver_name >> /tmp/teller.log
#echo $webserver_ip >> /tmp/teller.log

sshpass -pnutanix/4u ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no root@@@{LoadBalancer.address}@@ "echo $webserver_ip $webserver_name >> /etc/hosts"
sshpass -pnutanix/4u ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no root@@@{LoadBalancer.address}@@ "echo server $webserver_name $webserver_ip:80 check  >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg"

# restart the HAproxy service
sshpass -pnutanix/4u ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no root@@@{LoadBalancer.address}@@ service haproxy restart

action_list.name: action_install

# get some commandline calculator

# set the array index we need to manipulate the LB config file

# Debug teller

# wait for 5 seconds

echo @@{WebServer.address}@@ > /tmp/webserveripar

webserver_ip=$(cat /tmp/webserveripar | cut -d"," -f$teller)

action_list.description: System action for installing an application

attrs.script:
# Set the hostname accordingly
hostnamectl set-hostname @@{name}@@
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hosts
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hostname

# Update the system to the latest packages
apt-get update

# Do to possible 
DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get -y -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confdef" -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confold" upgrade
sh -c "echo 'LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8\nLANG=en_US.UTF-8' >> /etc/environment"

# Install the HAproxy package
apt-get install -y haproxy

# Configure to boot at startup
echo 'ENABLED=1' >> /etc/default/haproxy

# Configure the config file of HAproxy
echo ' ' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'listen appname' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'bind *:80' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'mode http' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'balance roundrobin' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'option httpclose' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'option forwardfor' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

# Check the haproxy config file
haproxy -f /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg -c

# Restart HAproxy due to config file change
service haproxy stop

attrs.script:
# Set the hostname accordingly
hostnamectl set-hostname @@{name}@@
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hosts
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hostname

# Update the system to the latest packages
apt-get update

# Do to possible 
DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get -y -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confdef" -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confold" upgrade
sh -c "echo 'LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8\nLANG=en_US.UTF-8' >> /etc/environment"

#!/bin/bash
# Setting the parameters for silent install of the MariaDB packages
# root as username and password for the variable 
#echo mysql-server-5.5 mysql-server/root_password password @@{MariaDB_Root_Password}@@ | debconf-set-selections
#echo mysql-server-5.5 mysql-server/root_password_again password @@{MariaDB_Root_Password}@@ | debconf-set-selections
debconf-set-selections <<< 'mariadb-server-10.0 mysql-server/root_password password nutanix/4u'
debconf-set-selections <<< 'mariadb-server-10.0 mysql-server/root_password_again password nutanix/4u'
	
apt-get install -y mariadb-server

# make sure MariaDB is listening on not just 127.0.0.1
sed -i "s:bind-address:#bind-address:g" /etc/mysql/mariadb.conf.d/50-server.cnf

# restart the MariaDB service
service mysql restart

# Set the hostname accordingly
hostnamectl set-hostname @@{name}@@
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hosts
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hostname

# Update the system to the latest packages
apt-get update

# Do to possible 
DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get -y -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confdef" -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confold" upgrade
sh -c "echo 'LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8\nLANG=en_US.UTF-8' >> /etc/environment"

# install nginx and the php engine for the dynamic data from the mariadb database
apt-get install -y nginx php-fpm php-mysql

# change the nginx configuragtion page
sed -i "s/index.html/index.html index.php/g" /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i "s/#location ~/location ~/g" /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i "s/#\tinclude snippets/\tinclude snippets/g" /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i "s:#\tfastcgi_pass unix:\tfastcgi_pass unix:g" /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i '0,/#}/s//}/' /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i "s:#\tdeny all:\tdeny all:g" /etc/nginx/sites-available/default
sed -i '0,/#}/s//}/' /etc/nginx/sites-available/default

# create a fast test php page				
echo '<?php phpinfo(); ?>' | tee /var/www/html/info.php
				
# Command to check the nginx configuration file
nginx -t

# restart the nginx webserver due to config changes
systemctl reload nginx

# cd into the right location due to pull from github using wget
cd /var/www/html
wget https://raw.githubusercontent.com/wessenstam/NutanixWorkshops/master/index.php

# change a parameter in the index.php file
sed -i 's:DATABASE_IP:@@{MariaDB.address}@@:g' index.php

# Install sshpass
apt-get install -y sshpass

#!/bin/bash

# get some commandline calculator
apt-get install bc

# set the array index we need to manipulate the LB config file
teller=$(echo "1+1*@@{calm_array_index}@@" | bc)

# Debug teller
#echo $teller > /tmp/teller.log

# wait for 5 seconds
sleep $teller

#use sshpass to manipulate the LB
echo @@{WebServer.name}@@ > /tmp/webservernamear
echo @@{WebServer.address}@@ > /tmp/webserveripar

# extract the right values from the dump of the Calm macros
webserver_name=$(cat /tmp/webservernamear | cut -d"," -f$teller)
webserver_ip=$(cat /tmp/webserveripar | cut -d"," -f$teller)

# extra debug
#echo $webserver_name >> /tmp/teller.log
#echo $webserver_ip >> /tmp/teller.log

sshpass -pnutanix/4u ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no root@@@{LoadBalancer.address}@@ "echo $webserver_ip $webserver_name >> /etc/hosts"
sshpass -pnutanix/4u ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no root@@@{LoadBalancer.address}@@ "echo server $webserver_name $webserver_ip:80 check  >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg"

# restart the HAproxy service
sshpass -pnutanix/4u ssh -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no root@@@{LoadBalancer.address}@@ service haproxy restart

# Set the hostname accordingly
hostnamectl set-hostname @@{name}@@
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hosts
sed -i 's:ub-gold-docker:@@{name}@@:g' /etc/hostname

# Update the system to the latest packages
apt-get update

# Do to possible 
DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get -y -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confdef" -o Dpkg::Options::="--force-confold" upgrade
sh -c "echo 'LC_ALL=en_US.UTF-8\nLANG=en_US.UTF-8' >> /etc/environment"

# Install the HAproxy package
apt-get install -y haproxy

# Configure to boot at startup
echo 'ENABLED=1' >> /etc/default/haproxy

# Configure the config file of HAproxy
echo ' ' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'listen appname' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'bind *:80' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'mode http' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'balance roundrobin' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'option httpclose' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg
echo 'option forwardfor' >> /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg

# Check the haproxy config file
haproxy -f /etc/haproxy/haproxy.cfg -c

# Restart HAproxy due to config file change
service haproxy stop

spec.name: WE 3 Tier application on Ubuntu 16_04 LTS

metadata.name: WE 3 Tier application on Ubuntu 16_04 LTS
